DataElement.preferredName: FACIT-Dyspnea 10 Item Short Form 6 How True Past Seven Days Short of Breath Severity Sweeping or Mopping Score 5 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Persons' stated observation of how true in the past 7 days they were short of breath when sweeping or mopping, using a five-point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: FACIT-Dyspnea 10 Item Short Form How True Past Week Dyspnea Severity Sweeping or Mopping Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A patient-reported outcome measure designed to evaluate an individual's shortness of breath across ten functional activities over the past 7 days._A question about an individual's agreement with a statement._The most recent week, including today._A question about how short of breath an individual gets or got when sweeping or mopping._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A patient-reported outcome measure designed to evaluate an individual's shortness of breath across ten functional activities over the past 7 days.

Concepts.definition: A patient-reported outcome measure designed to evaluate an individual's shortness of breath across ten functional activities over the past 7 days.

Property.preferredName: How True Past Week Dyspnea Severity Sweeping or Mopping Score
Property.preferredDefinition: A question about an individual's agreement with a statement.:The most recent week, including today.:A question about how short of breath an individual gets or got when sweeping or mopping.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: A question about an individual's agreement with a statement.
The most recent week. May include the present day.
A question about how short of breath an individual gets or got when sweeping or mopping.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

DataElementConcept.origin: FACIT-Dyspnea SF:FACIT-dyspnea (dyspnoea)-short form, Seung W. Choi, Ph.D., David Cella, Ph.D., R 01 October 2012

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An ordered Likert scale reference standard consisting of scores ranging from 0 (No shortness of breath) to 3 (Severely short of breath) and including a missing value reason, 4 (I did not do this in the past 7 days), used with the FACIT Dyspnea questionnaire.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: I did not do this in the past 7 days

ValueMeaning.preferredName: I did not do this in the past 7 days
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual has not done something in the past 7 days.

Concepts.longName: Did Not Do This Past 7 Days
Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual has not done something in the past 7 days.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual has or had severe shortness of breath.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual has or had severe shortness of breath.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual has or had moderate shortness of breath.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual has or had moderate shortness of breath.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual has or had mild shortness of breath.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual has or had mild shortness of breath.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual has or had no shortness of breath.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual has or had no shortness of breath.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

Concepts.definition: An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Using PRO/HRQoL Measures
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is part of a full set of items that comprise a PRO/HRQoL measure. The full set must be used without any changes to the questions or value set in order to retain the validity and reliability associated with the measure. The URL citation is provided so that caDSR users can obtain materials related to instructions for administering and/or scoring the measure. Changes may not be made to these documents.  In cases where retaining the question set intact to preserve the validity and reliability are not as important as advancing the science, questions may be used individually or in combination with other measure questions.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Scoring Manual Link
ReferenceDocuments.description: Scoring and Interpretation materials are accessible after registration on the FACIT website.
